text.p: French hotel group Accor SA said on Monday its stake in its Australian offshoot, AAPC Ltd, had been diluted to 22.0 percent from 23.0 percent previously due to an increase in the issued capital of the Australian company.

Despite the dilution, Accor said it now held more AAPC shares. The French company said in a substantial shareholder notice to the Australian Stock Exchange that it now held 128.01 million AAPC shares, compared with 125.64 million previously.
At 11.45 a.m. (0145 GMT), AAPC shares were steady at 83 cents.
